chapter.title: Extensions
chapter.para: Although Disnix makes the deployment of a distributed system more convenient and offers features to make this process reliable and efficient, some extensions have been developed to make this process more convenient.

section.title: DisnixWebService
section.para: In some cases other communication protocols are desired to use in order to connect to remote machines, except SSH. The DisnixWebService is a package that contains a SOAP interface for deployment operations and a disnix-soap-client utility to connect to it.

section.title: DisnixOS
section.para: Although Disnix manages the distributable components (services) of which a distributed system is composed and the inter-dependencies, Disnix does not manage the system configurations of the actual machines on which services are activated. The DisnixOS package comnbines the Disnix tooling and NixOS tooling to manage distributed system components and the underlying infrastructure based on NixOS system configurations, and an extension to automatically create virtual machine instances from the network configuration for testing.

section.title: Dynamic Disnix
section.para: Disnix implements a static deployment model -- to make it work it requires a infrastructure model and distribution model to be manually specified every time something in the configuration changes.

Dynamic Disnix is an extended toolset providing a discovery service to capture machine configurations in a network, as well as a distribution generation framework that can be used to generate a distribution model from technical and non-functional attributes of services and machines. These tools can be used to develop a framework enabling self adaptive (re)deployment of service-oriented systems.
